title: Ice climber fatality at The Junkyards near Canmore (Eugene/Yevhen/Zhenya Vahin, 33)
rescue_method: Ground recovery; body carried out by Kananaskis Mountain Rescue to RCMP
accident_summary_text: On January 23, 2025, 33-year-old ice climber Eugene (Yevhen/Zhenya) Vahin suffered a fatal unroped fall at The Junkyards near Grassi Lakes in Canmore, Alberta. RCMP and Kananaskis Mountain Rescue responded to an overdue-climber report and recovered his body. Officials said the exact circumstances and fall distance were unclear.
timeline_text: Jan 23: After a missed check-in and overdue report, RCMP requested assistance. Kananaskis Mountain Rescue deployed, located Vahin deceased at The Junkyards near Grassi Lakes, and recovered him to RCMP later that evening.

reported_circumstances.summary: Vahin was reported to be unroped and likely near the top of a route when he slipped; the fall was not captured on his camera. The precise fall distance remains unknown.
reported_circumstances.injury_details: Medical examiners reportedly indicated severe head injury and internal bleeding.

quoted_dialogue: The RCMP requested our assistance with a missing climber and when we were activated we located the subject and unfortunately he was deceased.
We had four of our staff respond and ended up just getting him out of that terrain and down to the RCMP.

cause_classification.narrative_summary: Climber was found deceased after an apparent unroped fall; exact circumstances and fall distance were not determined.

excluded_sources.reason: Outlier/contradictory event details (Index Town Wall, Washington; different incident).

We had four of our staff respond and ended up just getting him out of that terrain and down to the RCMP.

There are no details on what happened or how far Vahin fell.
The medical examiners told her Vahin likely died from a combination of severe head injury and internal bleeding.
The RCMP requested our assistance with a missing climber and when we were activated we located the subject and unfortunately he was deceased,
